images.title: Evelyn Simak / Green lane to Long Stratton
images.caption: Green lane to Long Stratton. The gate marks the start of a green lane leading northwards to Long Stratton. The track starts as the access road to Le Grys Farm - it turns off Common Road - which serves as a public footpath. Leading past the farm and farm cottage, the now unsurfaced track passes a cattle grid and leads through the northern edge of Wacton Common before turning sharply northwards. It emerges on Flowerpot Lane in Long Stratton.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / The Queens Head, The Street, Long Stratton
images.caption: The Queens Head, The Street, Long Stratton

description: This Norfolk based town is located in a pleasant rural spot halfway between Norwich and Diss. This circular walk from the town takes you south to explore Wacton Common. You can follow a pleasant country lane to the common where you will find grassland, five ponds, boundary ditches, hedgerow and occasional mature trees. It's a pleasant place for a walk with various footpaths to follow and nice views of the surrounding countryside. The return leg follows the Boudicca Way through the countryside to the east of the town. The long distance, waymarked trail is a good way of further exploring the area. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Long Stratton. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Queens Head is a friendly village pub serving good food. You can find them at postcode NR15 2XG.

display_address: Flowerpot Lane, Long Stratton, South Norfolk, Norfolk, England, NR15 2XW, United Kingdom
